question: Why am i getting a tingling feeling like i hit my funny bone when doing pushups?
question_content: Ive been doing more pushups than ive ever done for the past week nd lately, i get a tingling from my elbow to my palm when doing pushups, it doesnt hurt its really akward it feels like i hit my funny bone the tingling , so what is it? am i doing them wrong what should i do?

answers.answer_content: you probably diddle your fiddle too much, got the ol' tennis elbow if you know what i'm saying. give it a rest for a few days, stop watching so much iCarly and just go for a run in your niehgborhood.

Sounds a little like you may have a pulled ligament or tendon in your forearm.  You may want to give it some ice and a few days rest and see if that clears it up.

Do you use pushup bars?  If not you might wanna consider them - they keep your wrist aligned straight and reduce the strain on your wrist almost entirely... may be the best purchase you ever make.

Good luck!

Jorge, I think it is time that you saw either a neurologist or an orthopedist for this. The ulnar nerve is involved in what you are describing. So there are specific tests that should be done to tell if the nerve is trapped in some scar tissue or has been permanently injured from this incident.
